p: The laboratory diagnostics of dengue virus (DENV) infections is currently based on virus isolation, and detection of DENV RNA, non-structural protein 1 (NS1), and DENV-specific antibodies [4], [5]. Few laboratories can provide the full range, yet none of these assays covers the entire disease period [4], [5]. For a rational choice and timing of the tests, the kinetics of the various diagnostic markers needs to be understood. For efficient diagnostics, it appears that two or more methods should be combined.
